sen.j: 小出 英筠（こいで ふさたけ（ふさもと）、安永3年12月7日 (旧暦)（1775年1月8日） - 文政4年5月10日 (旧暦)（1821年6月9日））は、丹波国園部藩の第7代藩主。
sen.e: Fusatake (Fusamoto) KOIDE (January 8, 1775 - June 9, 1821) was the seventh feudal lord of Sonobe Domain in Tanba Province.
Fusatake (Fusamoto) KOIDE (January 8, 1775 - June 9, 1821) was the seventh feudal lord of Sonobe Domain in Tanba Province.
Fusatake (Fusamoto) KOIDE (January 8, 1775 - June 9, 1821) was the seventh feudal lord of Sonobe Domain in Tanba Province.
He was the seventh of the Koide family of the Yoshichika clan.
He was the seventh head of the Koide family of the Yoshichika clan.
He was the seventh head of the Koide family of the Yoshichika clan.

sen.j: 第6代藩主・小出英常の長男。
sen.e: He was a first son of the sixth feudal lord, Fusatsune KOIDE.
He was a first son of the sixth feudal lord, Fusatsune KOIDE.
He was a first son of the sixth feudal lord, Fusatsune KOIDE.
His mother was a daughter of Naoari II.
His mother was a daughter of Naoari II.
His mother was a daughter of Naoari II.
His lawful wife was a daughter of Yorikata MATSUDAIRA.
His lawful wife was a daughter of Yorikata MATSUDAIRA.
His lawful wife was a daughter of Yorikata MATSUDAIRA.
His second wife was a daughter of Mitsuzane WAKEBE.
His second wife was a daughter of Mitsuzane WAKEBE.
His second wife was a daughter of Mitsuzane WAKEBE.

sen.j: 子に小出祐英（長男）、小出英発（次男）、小出祐順（三男）、娘（稲垣長剛正室）。
sen.e: He had four children, Hirofusa KOIDE (the first son), Fusaoki KOIDE (the second son), 小出祐順 (the third son) and a daughter (lawful wife of Nagakata INAGAKI).
His children include Hirofusa KOIDE (the first son), Fusaoki KOIDE (the second son), 小出祐順 (the third son) and a daughter (lawful wife of Nagakata INAGAKI).
sen.cmt: 冒頭変更小出祐順の読み不明
sen.e: His children include Hirofusa KOIDE (the first son), Fusaoki KOIDE (the second son), 小出祐順 (the third son) and a daughter (lawful wife of Nagakata INAGAKI).

sen.j: 官位は従五位下、信濃国守、伊勢国守。
sen.e: He served as Jugoinoge (Junior Fifth Rank, Lower Grade), Shinano no kuni no kami (Governor of Shinano Province), and director of Ise Province.
He served as Jugoinoge (Junior Fifth Rank, Lower Grade), Shinano no kuni no kami (Governor of Shinano Province), and director of Ise Province.
He served as Jugoinoge (Junior Fifth Rank, Lower Grade), Shinano no kuni no kami (Governor of Shinano Province), and director of Ise Province.

sen.j: 安永4年（1775年）、父の死去により2歳で後を継ぐ。
sen.e: In 1775, he succeeded his father as the head of a family due to his father's death.
In 1775, Due to his father's death, he succeeded to be the head of family at the age of 2.
sen.cmt: at the age of 2 追加し、文章構造変更。
sen.e: In 1775, Due to his father's death, he succeeded to be the head of family at the age of 2.

sen.j: 天明7年（1787年）11月、天明の大飢饉が原因で大規模な百姓一揆が起こり、その鎮圧と解決に努めた。
sen.e: In December, 1787, the Tenmei Famine led to a large scale peasant's revolt, and he strived to suppress and settle it.
In December, 1787, the Tenmei Famine led to a large scale peasant's revolt, and he strived to suppress and settle it.
In December, 1787, the Tenmei Famine led to a large scale peasant's revolt, and he strived to suppress and settle it.

sen.j: 藩財政窮乏化のため、タバコの専売制を実施し、さらに藩校・教先館を設立する。
sen.e: Because of the impoverishment of finance of the clan, he carried out monopolization of tobacco, and in addition, he established the hanko, Kyosenkan School.
Because of the impoverishment of finance of the clan, he carried out monopolization of tobacco, and in addition, he established the hanko, Kyosenkan School.
Because of the impoverishment of finance of the clan, he carried out monopolization of tobacco, and in addition, he established the hanko, Kyosenkan School.

sen.j: 財政改革にはあまり効果が無かったが、文化的には発展した。
sen.e: Although his financial reform wasn't very effective, cultural policy was developed.
Although his financial reform wasn't very effective, cultural policy was developed.
Although his financial reform wasn't very effective, cultural policy was developed.

sen.j: 文政4年（1821年）5月10日、48歳で死去し、後を次男・英発が継いだ。
sen.e: June 9, 1821, he died at the age of 48, and his second son, Fusaoki succeeded him.
June 9, 1821, he died at the age of 48, and his second son, Fusaoki succeeded him.
June 9, 1821, he died at the age of 48, and his second son, Fusaoki succeeded him.
